*HubSpot Not Assigning Support Emails to Clients*

Hello everyone, I have an issue with incoming emails in HubSpot, and maybe someone here can help me, since HubSpot support wasn’t able to provide a solution.

*Our Setup:*
• We have a WordPress website with Contact Form 7.
• A support form is available for clients to submit requests.
• Submitted forms send emails to our support inbox (which is integrated into HubSpot).
• We use WP Mail SMTP Pro with Brevo to send emails.
*The Problem:*
• To avoid spoofing & spam, emails are always sent from our own email (`info@`) instead of the client’s email.
• Because of this, HubSpot always assigns the emails to our own contact instead of the respective client.
• We are already using the Reply-To header to include the client's email, but HubSpot does not seem to recognize it for contact assignment.
*Constraints & Notes:*
• Switching to a native HubSpot form is not an option, because we need to pass additional user data via email to our support team.
Has anyone faced a similar issue or found a workaround?
Any help would be greatly appreciated!
